org.jnetpcap.packet
Class JPacketBuffer

java.lang.Object
  org.jnetpcap.nio.JMemory
      org.jnetpcap.nio.JBuffer
          org.jnetpcap.packet.JPacketBuffer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<JPacket>
public class JPacketBuffer
extends JBuffer
implements java.lang.Iterable<JPacket>

A memory buffer used to hold multiple packets. This specialized buffer is filled by jNetPcap with multiple raw packet data and capture headers upto the specified size of the buffer. The packets can then be accessed via accessor methods. The structure of the data within the buffer is as follows: 

 [count][capture header 1][packet data 1][capture header n][packet data n]

Author:
Mark Bednarczyk, Sly Technologies, Inc.
See Also:
Pcap.loop(int, JPacketBufferHandler, Object), Pcap.dispatch(int, int, JPacketBufferHandler, Object), JPacketBufferHandler

Method Detail

getPacketCount

public int getPacketCount()
Gets the number of packets stored in this buffer. The count indicates how many pairs of capture header and packet data have been stored within this buffer.

Returns:
number of packets stored in this buffer
